intro: Leontodon hyoseroides subsp. hyoseroides, commonly known as the common hawk's-beard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a robust stem with rough, hairy texture. Its basal leaves are lance-shaped and often have a wavy margin, while the upper leaves are smaller and more linear. The plant produces bright yellow composite flowers in late spring to early summer, with a distinctive ray floret structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas.
